alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 11:55AM EDT until March 27 at 10:08AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River. Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. Flatrock River near Columbus. Driftwood River near Edinburgh. Big Blue River at Shelbyville. .Significant rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches last week has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with several smaller tributaries. Moderate flooding is occurring on a small portion of the East Fork White River, and is expected to develop in the coming days on the lower reaches of the White and Wabash Rivers. Water continues to rise in many locations. The crests on the main stem rivers are in the following locations currently. On the Wabash, upstream of Lafayette. On the White, near or just south of Centerton, and along the East Fork White, between Shelbyville and Columbus. Most smaller tributaries are past crest and falling. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas, particularly in southwest Indiana along the lower reaches of the main stem rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Blue River at Shelbyville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect business and residential property. West Washington Avenue east of rendering plant begins to flood. In winter and spring, persons are not too concerned. This level is rather unusual for summer. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Sunday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by 11 PM EDT this evening.
